definition: office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: It's there , between the video arcade and the post office.
sentences.chinese: 它在那儿，在电子游戏中心与邮局之间。

sentences.english: Christmas tree from a VFW post.
sentences.chinese: 一棵在VFW邮局里的圣诞树。

sentences.english: We gave you a post-office box two months ago.
sentences.chinese: 我们两个月前给了您一个邮局的信箱。

sentences.english: I watched him step off the pavement, cross the street, and disappear into the post office.
sentences.chinese: 我看见他走下人行道，过行街，进了邮局。

sentences.english: Most newsagents or post offices have a copying machine.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的邮局都有影印的服务。

sentences.english: Social volunteers help the visually impaired along grooved tracks at Dongsi Post Office.
sentences.chinese: 东四邮局铺盲道，志愿者做引导。

sentences.english: I saw her step  the street and disappear into the post-office.
sentences.chinese: 我看见她在街上步行，进了邮局就不见了。

sentences.english: The post-office is only three blocks away.
sentences.chinese: 只横穿三条马路就是邮局。

sentences.english: Mail is backing up at the post office.
sentences.chinese: 邮件积滞在那个邮局里。

sentences.english: Mailmen sort the mails at the post offices before distribution.
sentences.chinese: 邮件在寄走前由邮递员在邮局分发。

sentences.english: And, you can find him keeping the post office spotlessly clean six days a week.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到，他每星期六天把邮局整理得一尘不染。

sentences.english: There is a beautiful park, it"s between the postoffice and the supermarket. People walk in the park."
sentences.chinese: 小区内有一个美丽的大公园，他在邮局和超市之间。

sentences.english: Men in the post office classify mail according to places it is to go.
sentences.chinese: 邮局里的人员将信件按寄送地点分类。

sentences.english: The post office got behind in delivering Christmas mail.
sentences.chinese: 邮局没有及时发送圣诞节邮件。

sentences.english: On Center Street, there is a restaurant, a post office and a library.
sentences.chinese: 在中心街，有一家餐厅，一个邮局和一个图书馆。

sentences.english: Walk down this street to its end and the post office is oon your right.
sentences.chinese: 沿这条街走到尽头，邮局就在你的右边。

definition: mail room/radio room (i.e. reception and transmission)
ordinary mail (as opposed to air mail etc)
